abstract: If we can learn not to freak out when they freak out, we can help them learn to regulate emotions on their own.
snippet: If we can learn not to freak out when they freak out, we can help them learn to regulate emotions on their own.
lead_paragraph: When I describe the process I went through to get my 3-year-old into preschool to non-New Yorkers, they look at me as if I was wearing an astronaut suit to a dinner party. Eight interviews? Eight tours? Eight applications? For a kid who still has trouble drinking out of a cup? Absurd.

headline.main: Seeing Tantrums as Distress, Not Defiance
